clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Rate Variability Under Propofol and Sevoflurane
clinical_study.official_title: Spectral Analysis of Heart Rate Variability at BIS 25 and BIS 55 Under Propofol or Sevoflurane

brief_summary.textblock: Patients were randomized into 2 groups according to the anesthetic, propofol or sevoflurane. Induction and maintenance were standardized, and after the end of surgery, two steady-state recordings were performed at BIS 25 and BIS 55. Bispectral Index and ECG were continuously recorded and cardiac autonomic nervous activity was investigated using spectral analysis of RR Interval variability

primary_outcome.measure: Spectral analysis of heart rate variability with a bispectral index of 25
primary_outcome.description: Fast Fourier Transform applied to heart rate signal recording

primary_outcome.measure: Spectral analysis of heart rate variability with a bispectral index of 55
primary_outcome.description: Fast Fourier Transform applied to heart rate signal recording

arm_group.description: General anesthesia using sevoflurane as a hypnotic agent, and remifentanil as an analgesic. Two steady state periods of 10 minutes each, one with a steady bispectral index at 25 +/- 5, the other with a steady bispectral index at 55 +/- 5. Continuous recording of heart rate during the last minute of each steady-state. Off-line spectral analysis of heart rate variability.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA risk classification 1 or 2,
- scheduled for middle ear surgery, or cardiovascular ANS activity.
Exclusion Criteria:
- preoperative medications that interfere with the autonomic nervous system
- preoperative medications that interfere with the central nervous system
